access: Knights of Lastwall have access to this weapon.
markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Weapon 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[War Lance](/Weapons.aspx?ID=254)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Deadly d8" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=174" />
<trait label="Jousting d6" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=186" />
<trait label="Parry" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=190" />
<trait label="Shove" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=193" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 87</row>

**Access** Knights of Lastwall have access to this weapon.

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 4 gp

**Damage** 1d8 P

**Bulk** 2
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Hands** 2

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Category** Martial

**Group** [Spear](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=14)
</row>

</column>

---

This lance appears shorter and stockier in comparison to other weapons of its type. The war lance most notably features shielding integrated into its vamplate, exchanging its reach for a sturdier base when defending against attacks or attempting to overpower an opponent.

<title level="2">Critical Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 283 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon.

[Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).

<document level="2" id="weapon-group-14" />
name: War Lance

text: <title level="1" right="Weapon 0" pfs="Standard" > War Lance Source Knights of Lastwall pg. 87 Access Knights of Lastwall have access to this weapon. Price 4 gp Damage 1d8 P Bulk 2 Hands 2 Category Martial Group Spear --- This lance appears shorter and stockier in comparison to other weapons of its type. The war lance most notably features shielding integrated into its vamplate, exchanging its reach for a sturdier base when defending against attacks or attempting to overpower an opponent. Critical Specialization Effects Source Core Rulebook pg. 283 4.0 Certain feats, class features, weapon runes, and other effects can grant you additional benefits when you make a Strike with certain weapons and get a critical success. This is called a critical specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which weapon group your weapon belongs to, as listed below. You can always decide not to add the critical specialization effect of your weapon. Click here for the full rules on Critical Specialization Effects.
